summary: This document is an email from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio forwarding multiple appeals and complaints regarding alleged SEC corruption and financial fraud. It details accusations against FTE Networks (and related entities), Parallax Health Sciences, and other companies, alleging they are money laundering shells facilitated by the SEC, FINRA, and specific individuals. The email criticizes the SEC's enforcement actions as fraudulent and obstructive, and references numerous other cases and individuals involved in alleged securities fraud.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the email and primary whistleblower alleging massive SEC corruption, financial fraud, and money laundering involving multiple companies and individuals. He references his own TCRs (Tip, Complaint, or Referral) and correspondence with regulators.

persons.name: Agent Sweeney
persons.context: Mentioned rhetorically by Dilorio questioning FBI training on money laundering in the context of the FTE Networks case.

persons.name: Mrs. John 'Rusty' Wing
persons.context: Referenced as someone who 'piled on to bring yet ANOTHER fraud to the SDNY Courts' in relation to FTE Networks.

persons.name: Mr. Bustilloe
persons.context: Mentioned alongside 'Miami SEC' in the context of charges against FTE Networks executives.

persons.name: Michael Beys
persons.role: Former EDNY prosecutor, Interim CEO of FTE
persons.context: Identified as the interim CEO of FTE Networks and a former Eastern District of New York prosecutor.

persons.name: Judge Oetken
persons.context: Addressed directly in the email regarding the Parallax case and alleged SEC fraud on the courts.

persons.name: Vikas Arora
persons.context: IRS Criminal Investigation agent who, along with Nate Sarnacki, flew to Denver in April 2016 to meet with Dilorio regarding his TCR.

persons.name: Nate Sarnacki
persons.context: IRS Criminal Investigation agent who met with Dilorio in Denver in April 2016.

persons.name: Kevin Goodman
persons.context: Referenced as the SEC official who produced a 'bullshit "order handling" complaint' regarding Parallax. Later noted as having a new title overseeing FINRA and Securities Industry Oversight (FSIO).

persons.name: Paul Arena
persons.context: CEO of Parallax Health Sciences, charged by the SEC for misleading COVID-19 disclosures. Described as well-known to the SEC and involved in other alleged money laundering shells.

persons.name: Nathaniel Bradley
persons.context: Co-defendant with Paul Arena in the SEC's Parallax COVID-19 disclosure complaint.

persons.name: Keith Coulston
persons.context: Named as being behind Ionic Ventures, a firm described as a 'prolific Bag Men' entity involved in money laundering shells like AQR.

persons.name: Michael Sobeck
persons.role: Associated with Harbor Gates Capital LLC
persons.context: Described as a 'Prolific Bag Man' formerly with Tangiers, involved in NITE top-traded shells. A selling shareholder in the Parallax S-1.

persons.name: Christina Avila
persons.role: Associated with Harbor Gates Capital LLC
persons.context: Associated with Harbor Gates Capital LLC in Puerto Rico, a selling shareholder in the Parallax S-1.

persons.name: Richard Rosenblum
persons.context: Controls The Cobran LLC, a selling shareholder in the Parallax S-1. Also involved with Harborview Advisors and Innovative Payment Solutions (IPSI).

persons.name: David Stefansky
persons.context: Associated with Harborview Advisors and involved in money laundering shell Aquamed Technologies/Nexgel.

persons.name: Nachum Stein
persons.role: CEO/Chairman of American European Insurance Group
persons.context: CEO/Chairman of American European Insurance Group, controlled Aquamed/Nexgel with David Stefansky.

persons.name: Robert Klimov
persons.context: Investor in IPSI through Bellridge Capital, also involved in money laundering shell Black Cactus Global Inc.

persons.name: Milton Ault
persons.context: Controller of DPW Holdings, parent company of Digital Power Lending LLC, a seller in the Parallax S-1.

persons.name: Michael Wachs
persons.context: Investor in DPW Holdings through Esousa, partner of Peizer, connected to Net Element and Milken obstruction of justice.

persons.name: David Solomon
persons.context: Referenced as 'David "djdsol" Solomon', current CEO of Goldman Sachs, connected to Milken obstruction of justice.

persons.name: Ofer Abarbanel
persons.context: Subject of an SEC complaint for allegedly transferring $102 million from investors into NARL accounts.

persons.name: Nicholas Abbate
persons.role: COO of State Funds/New York Alaska
persons.context: Former 'independent' Market Maker at Knight Capital, COO of State Funds/New York Alaska, which received the $102 million investor funds. Omitted from the SEC's Abarbanel complaint.

persons.name: Mr. Paley
persons.role: Head of SEC Micro Cap Fraud Task Force
persons.context: Addressed rhetorically by Dilorio questioning the effectiveness of the SEC's Micro Cap Fraud Task Force.

persons.name: Mr. Gensler
persons.context: Addressed regarding the need to repeal a rule exempting 90% of 13F filers, as per Congress's will.

persons.name: Mr. Gottschall
persons.context: Addressed rhetorically regarding locating 'Castle Rock' and the RIOT Blockchain/Bitmain transactions.

persons.name: Mathis Schultz
persons.context: Founder of Northern Data AG, a former private banker at Julius Baer, LGT, and Elan Capital Management.

persons.name: Chad Everett Harris
persons.context: Identified as the person hired by Mathis Schultz to build the 1Gig+ data center in Rockdale, Texas for Northern Data.

connections.description: Dilorio sent his TCR to Goodman in July 2015, and alleges Goodman produced a misleading 'order handling' complaint regarding Parallax months later as a form of obstruction.
Both were charged by the SEC as executives of Parallax Health Sciences for misleading COVID-19 disclosures.
Coulston's Ionic Ventures is described as formerly Ironridge, a firm the SEC knows well and is labeled a 'prolific Bag Men' entity.
Both are connected through Harborview Advisors NJ and were involved in the money laundering shell Aquamed Technologies/Nexgel.
Stein and Stefansky jointly controlled the money laundering shell Aquamed Technologies/Nexgel.
Wachs's Esousa is an investor in Ault's DPW Holdings.
Connected through references to Milken obstruction of justice, with Solomon noted as 'djdsol'.
Abarbanel transferred $102 million to accounts at State Funds/New York Alaska, where Abbate was COO. Abbate is omitted from the SEC complaint against Abarbanel.
Schultz, founder of Northern Data, hired Harris to build a large data center in Rockdale, Texas.

events.title: Dilorio's Email Forwarding Appeals
events.description: Christopher J. Dilorio sends an email forwarding multiple formal appeals and TCRs, alleging widespread SEC corruption and ongoing financial fraud.

events.title: IRS CI Meeting with Dilorio
events.description: IRS CI agents Vikas Arora and Nate Sarnacki flew from Chicago to Denver to meet with Christopher Dilorio regarding his IRS TCR based on his SEC TCR.

events.title: Dilorio Sends TCR to Kevin Goodman
events.description: Christopher Dilorio sent his TCR to SEC's Kevin Goodman, which he claims led to Goodman producing a misleading 'order handling' complaint months later.

events.title: FTE Networks Acquires Benchmark Construction
events.description: FTE Networks acquired Benchmark Construction for $74,245,000, a company with claimed historical revenue of $300-$400 million, which later appeared to disappear from FTE's financials.

events.title: SEC Approves Parallax S-1 Offering
events.description: The SEC approved a Parallax Health Sciences Form S-1 registration with multiple selling shareholders, which Dilorio analyzes to show connections to alleged money laundering entities.

events.title: SEC Charges Parallax for COVID-19 Disclosures
events.description: The SEC charges Parallax Health Sciences and executives Paul Arena and Nathaniel Bradley for misleading COVID-19 disclosures, a case Dilorio calls a fraud on the court.

events.title: Northern Data Sells Texas Data Center to Riot Blockchain
events.description: Northern Data AG completes the sale of its Whinstone US data center in Rockdale, Texas, to Riot Blockchain, Inc.

keyFacts: The whistleblower, Christopher J. Dilorio, alleges the SEC is a 'grossly corrupt, criminal organization' actively facilitating massive, ongoing frauds and money laundering through shell companies.
FTE Networks is accused of being a money laundering shell that fraudulently acquired Benchmark Construction to inflate revenue, with its interim CEO being a former EDNY prosecutor, Michael Beys.

The SEC's case against Parallax Health Sciences for COVID-19 disclosures is characterized as a fraudulent omission designed to protect underlying money laundering activities and the involved broker-dealers like NITE and UBS.

Dilorio claims the SEC, FINRA, and individuals like Kevin Goodman have criminally obstructed his whistleblower claims and outsourced oversight of the OTC market to FINRA, which is funded by the firms it regulates.

The email details a complex network of individuals and entities (e.g., Ironridge/Ionic, Harbor Gates, The Cobran LLC, DPW Holdings) involved as 'prolific Bag Men' in converting worthless certificates from sham companies into cash via illegal naked shorting.
